title: Projects
text:
I am currently studying Computer Science with an emphasis in algorithms and machine learning. During my studies I have learned and applied different skillsets such as algorithmic thinking, web development, programming in different languages, and encryption. I have mastered the basics of computer programming by understanding class structures, data structures, and object-oriented programming.
Below are pages that will have links to different pojects I’ve worked on. If you have any questions about any of them, feel free to shoot me an email.

title: Professional Opportunities
text:
Year 1 – Get a job as a software engineer

Networking

Talk with my contacts in the field already
Ask for more informational interviews

Prepare

Finish two projects:

One with AI
One without AI



Year 2 – Get promoted in some capacity

Leadership

Ask my superiors how I can show leadership abilities
Go the extra mile on projects

Technical

Continue learning through implementation:

Always have a personal project in the background


Networking

Go to hackathons, conferences, etc. to meet people and stay up to date in the technology of the field


Year 3 – Get promoted as Senior developer

Leadership

Offer to help those that are struggling with their code
Serve as a team lead at a hackathon

Teamwork

Ask my superiors where I need to improve to become more effective for them


Year 4 – Found a start up

Networking

Talk with peers about an idea and ask if they are interested in helping me out
Find avenues of funding so that we can get the money that we need for it

Leadership

Have a vision for the project
Lay out components that I need for it
Delegate to those that are willing to start this with me

title: Lehi Gracia
text:
Hello and welcome to my portfolio showcasing the different projects that I’ve worked on, the accomplishments I’ve achieved, and the journey I’ve gone through as a Software Developer. I build thoughtful, end-to-end software that bridges elegant front-end experiences with powerful, cloud-native back-ends.
As a full-stack developer specializing in Go, React, and AWS, I’m passionate about creating reliable systems that solve real problems — from secure data pipelines to seamless user interfaces. I approach each project with curiosity, precision, and a drive to learn, aiming to craft software that’s as scalable as it is meaningful.
This site showcases my ongoing projects, technical explorations, and the creative process behind my work as a developer.

title: Data Analysis and Visualization
text:
Project link
Using a decision tree machine learning algorithm, I developed a model to determine whether a house was built before or after 1980, based on several data points. The report indicates that the number of stories a house has, the type of garage, and the living area significantly contribute to the algorithm’s ability to determine the construction date.

title: Algorithmic Thinking
text:
Project link
This is a project that encapsulates a simple algorithm in always winning tic tac toe. Originally designed to be played by two people, this program makes it possible to play tic tac toe with just yourself. The program uses Go as the only language.

title: About Me
text:
Lehi Gracia

Feel free to send me an email
Let’s connect on LinkedIn

I’ve been programming since I was 14 years old, and ever since then, I haven’t stopped learning and creating. What started as a curiosity for how code works has grown into a lifelong passion for building systems that are efficient, secure, and meaningful.
I’m currently pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science with an emphasis in Algorithms and Machine Learning at Brigham Young University–Idaho, where I’ve gained a deep understanding of how math, logic, and good software design come together to solve real-world problems.
Recently, I interned as a Software Engineer at BoomID, where I developed cloud-based systems using Go and AWS to analyze photo metadata for biometric authentication and designed a secure “lock box” for encrypted file sharing. Through that experience, I discovered how much I enjoy bridging front-end, back-end, and cloud architecture to deliver full solutions.
Beyond the technical side, I’ve also worked in customer- facing roles where I learned the importance of empathy, clear communication, and teamwork—skills that now influence how I approach both people and code.
I’m passionate about writing clean, maintainable code, continuously improving my craft, and collaborating on projects that make a difference. I’m currently working on several personal projects involving Go, React, and AWS, with the goal of refining my skills in full-stack and cloud-native development.

title: Database Design
text:
Star Wars Database
From a database of survey responses from people who like Star Wars, I created new dataframes that would help answer some questions about the data. These new datatframes also helped me make a machine learning algorithm that predicted a person’s income based on the info gathered in the surveys.

title: Machine Learning
text:
Colab link
FyodorAI was a project we made as a team, where I was team lead, to put in practice the skills we were learning in class. This model uses Keras and TensorFlow libraries to build the model. The model is then trained on Crime and Punishment, Brothers of Karamazov, The Idiot, and The Possessed, which are all found in the gutenberg online library. After this training, the model then recieves a prompt and from the prompt it creates a story.

title: Machine Learning

title: Machine Learning
text:
ShakespeareAI
Colab link
ShakespeareAI was a similar project that I spearheaded alone. In the same way, it trains a couple books of the Shakespeare plays and then with a prompt it can generate up to 100 words. This uses the same libraries and technologies as the previous ones.

title: Programming Profeciency
text:
Project Link
This is a meditation program that uses polymorphism and inheritance to have four different types of meditation. This program is written primarily in C#. Using the Object Oriented parts of the langauge, I create this program for those that want help in meditation.

title: Programming Profeciency
text:
Python
Project Link
This is a program that removes greenscreen from a video and replaces it with the desired image. This uses parallism and concurrency to remove the green pixels from each image. You can submit any image you to replace the green screen, or if you have an image with green in it, then it can replace those green pixels. Basically, it finds the green pixels to replace on one image to replace them with another image.

title: Security and Authentication
text:
Project Link
This project uses C# as its only language. It also uses a couple of libraries that create sockets that then are used to send and recieve files locally from computer to computer. This program also gives the option of using encryption on a file and then decrypting that file.

title: Security and Authentication
section: Utilizing GopenPGP and AWS S3 Buckets
text:
Utilizing GopenPGP and AWS S3 Buckets
Project Link
This project uses Go as its only language. This uses the common GopenPGP library. This program can receive a file, encrypt that file with the specified public key of the recipient, send the file to an S3 bucket, then can be retrieved and decrypted using the public and private key of the recipient.
